maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the SMB client configuration.
The Get-SmbClientConfiguration cmdlet retrieves the Server Message Block (SMB) client configuration.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The MSFT_SmbClientConfiguration object represents the configuration of the SMB client.

command:example.maml:title: ----------- Example 1: Get the client configuration -----------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-SmbClientConfiguration ConnectionCountPerRssNetworkInterface : 4 DirectoryCacheEntriesMax : 16 DirectoryCacheEntrySizeMax : 65536 DirectoryCacheLifetime : 10 EnableBandwidthThrottling : True EnableByteRangeLockingOnReadOnlyFiles : True EnableLargeMtu : True EnableMultiChannel : True DormantFileLimit : 1023 EnableSecuritySignature : True ExtendedSessionTimeout : 1000 FileInfoCacheEntriesMax : 64 FileInfoCacheLifetime : 10 FileNotFoundCacheEntriesMax : 128 FileNotFoundCacheLifetime : 5 KeepConn : 600 MaxCmds : 50 MaximumConnectionCountPerServer : 32 OplocksDisabled : False RequireSecuritySignature : False SessionTimeout : 60 UseOpportunisticLocking : True WindowSizeThreshold : 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves the SMB client configuration.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the SMB client configuration.
The Set-SmbClientConfiguration cmdlet sets the Server Message Block (SMB) client configuration.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the SMB connection count per each RSS network interface.
Specifies the maximum cache entries that can be in the directory cache.
Specifies the maximum size of directory cache entry.
Specifies the directory cache lifetime.
Specifies that the SMB client ignores all requests for compression from applications or SMB servers.
Specifies the dormant file limit.
Indicates that bandwidth throttling is enabled.
Indicates that byte range locking on read-only files is enabled.
Indicates whether SMB client will allow insecure guest logons to an SMB server.
Indicates that large MTU is enabled.
Indicates whether load balance scale out is enabled.
Indicates that multi-channel is enabled.
Indicates that the security signature is enabled.
Specifies the extended session time-out.
Specifies the maximum number entries that can be in the file information cache.
Specifies the file information cache lifetime.
Specifies the maximum number entries that can be in the file not found cache.
Specifies the file not found cache lifetime.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies that the SMB client uses SMB encryption inside of the SMB over QUIC TLS 1.3 encrypted tunnel even if the SMB server does not require it.
Specifies the time, in seconds, before the SMB client session is automatically disconnected.
Specifies the maximum number of concurrent outstanding network requests that the SMB client supports.
Specifies the maximum connection count per server.
Indicates that opportunistic locks are disabled.
Indicates that the security signature is required.
Specifies the session time-out.
Specifies that the SMB client not trust the SMB over QUIC SMB server certificate issuer. Required when using a self-signed certificate.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Indicates that opportunistic locks are used.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the window size threshold.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the SMB connection count per each RSS network interface.
Specifies the maximum cache entries that can be in the directory cache.
Specifies the maximum size of directory cache entry.
Specifies the directory cache lifetime.
Specifies that the SMB client ignores all requests for compression from applications or SMB servers.
Specifies the dormant file limit.
Indicates that bandwidth throttling is enabled.
Indicates that byte range locking on read-only files is enabled.
Indicates whether SMB client will allow insecure guest logons to an SMB server.
Indicates that large MTU is enabled.
Indicates whether load balance scale out is enabled.
Indicates that multi-channel is enabled.
Indicates that the security signature is enabled.
Specifies the extended session time-out.
Specifies the maximum number entries that can be in the file information cache.
Specifies the file information cache lifetime.
Specifies the maximum number entries that can be in the file not found cache.
Specifies the file not found cache lifetime.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies that the SMB client uses SMB encryption inside of the SMB over QUIC TLS 1.3 encrypted tunnel even if the SMB server does not require it.
Specifies the time, in seconds, before the SMB client session is automatically disconnected.
Specifies the maximum number of concurrent outstanding network requests that the SMB client supports.
Specifies the maximum connection count per server.
Indicates that opportunistic locks are disabled.
Indicates that the security signature is required.
Specifies the session time-out.
Specifies that the SMB client not trust the SMB over QUIC SMB server certificate issuer. Required when using a self-signed certificate.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Indicates that opportunistic locks are used.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the window size threshold.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 1: Set the SMB client configuration ---------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-SmbClientConfiguration -ConnectionCountPerRssNetworkInterface 8 Confirm Are you sure you want to perform this action? Performing operation 'Modify' on Target 'SMB Client Configuration'. [Y] Yes [A] Yes to All [N] No [L] No to All [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"):

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the SMB client configuration.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Set the SMB client configuration without confirmation

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the SMB client configuration without user confirmation.
